_description: This file shows how to configure automatic responses when users type specific words in Discord messages.
_instructions: 1. Copy this file to 'autoResponses.json' to use it
3. Use <username> to insert the user's name in the response
4. Set 'enabled' to false to disable the feature globally

bot._comment: Example: Case-sensitive trigger (only matches 'bot', not 'Bot' or 'BOT')
bot.response: Yes, I'm a bot! Ask me anything.

_settings_explanation.enabled: Set to false to disable all auto-responses globally
_settings_explanation.triggerWords: Object containing all trigger word configurations
_settings_explanation.response: The message the bot will send. Use <username> to insert the sender's name
_settings_explanation.caseSensitive: If true, only matches exact case. If false, matches any case (e.g., 'Hello' matches 'hello', 'HELLO', 'HeLLo')
_settings_explanation.wholeWord: If true, only matches whole words. If false, matches partial words (e.g., 'bot' matches 'bot' but not 'robot')
_settings_explanation.cooldown: Minimum time in milliseconds between responses for the same user and trigger (5000 = 5 seconds)

_best_practices: Use reasonable cooldowns to prevent spam (3-10 seconds recommended)
Test new triggers in a private channel first
Consider using wholeWord: true to avoid accidental triggers
Use <username> to make responses more personal

steps: 6. The bot will automatically reload the configuration
